intro: Echites plicatus, commonly known as the zigzagged spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in a cup-like structure called a cyathium. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy coating. Echites plicatus is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
